Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, interior very worn, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as [wine of the western] river.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 38
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393190) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393190)
